subject: Re: FW: Total Contacts - credit card payment issue?

full_threads.body: (Time: 15mins)

Hi Erin,

Sure, I'm really glad we’ve finally got it sorted!

The issue came down to a combination of two things:
  • API Keys — The connection details (API keys) that allow the plugin to talk to Cybersource needed to be updated. These keys can sometimes expire or need to be refreshed due to security updates or changes in the system.
  • Plugin Version — The plugin itself was slightly behind. On June 16, we updated it to version 2.9.3 and tested it with the new keys, but unfortunately it still wasn’t working. Then, just last night, the plugin developers released a newer version (2.9.4). After updating to this latest version and testing everything again with the updated keys, it all started working correctly.

It was really just a case of some unfortunate timing - the plugin update that fully resolved the issue was only released very recently.

Hi Joel,

Thank you for letting me know, that's great news!

However, I have been literally tearing my hair out over this for almost a week now so it would be great to know what the actual problem was please?

Thank you

Erin Skinner TOTAL EYECARE SUPPORT GROUP

Administration Manager



Total Eyecare Support Group

18 Magnet Court, Sandy Bay TAS 7005

P: 03 6231 5744 E: accounts@totaleyecare.com.au

totaleyecare.com.au

(Time: 60mins)

Hi Erin,

Thanks for looking into this.

I just made a test and it is working fine now.

Thanks for all your help.

Hi Joel,

You haven't heard from me today as it has taken until now to get somewhere with this, and actually I've gotten nowhere, so I am coming back to you for further help please.

I haven't been able to contact Cybersource directly, as we don't have a direct contact. And for reasons I don't know, their avenues of contact are not working, they are throwing error screens at me.

So I then reached out to ANZ Worldline support, who have communicated with Cybersource in the past for us. I explained we need help and provided the details you suggested we forward on. They have only just responded to me and their message was as follows:

If it's a woocommerce plugin for Cybersource, you and your web dev need to engage the plugin provider as it will be coding within the plugin.

We generally do not provide support for plugins since they do not belong to ANZWL.

There are up coming releases in which may be the plugin has been updated to, and you may just need to upgrade your version perhaps as a wild guess.

Happy to be looped in your communications with them in case there is something they would like to ask us to support you too.

In further conversation about this with Andrew Dunham, he has forwarded me a couple of emails received from Cybersource earlier this year. I can't find record in my emails of having received these emails myself, so I'm not sure who has read or sought to action them, but I wonder if this message may be relevant. The email is as below:

Dear Valued Customer,

You are receiving this notification as you have been identified as a merchant utilizing our Flex API Direct Integration.

This is the first of a series of notifications that will help you make the changes needed to move to the new and upgraded Flex API solution experience (Flex API v2).

Overview

The Flex API enables merchants to securely accept customer payment information captured within a server-side application or on a customer's device, for example within a native iOS or Android application. The Flex API protects your customer's primary account number (PAN), card verification number (CVN), and other payment information by embedding it within a transient token, reducing risk and simplifying Payment Card Industry Data Security Standard (PCI DSS) compliance.

As part of our commitment to modernizing our offerings and enhancing the security of our products, we are deprecating older versions of the Flex API. This initiative is designed to improve security for payment card transactions, safeguard sensitive information, maintain trust in electronic payment systems, and reduce the likelihood of data breaches.

By upgrading to the latest versions of our Flex API product, merchants can take advantage of the latest security enhancements and technological advancements, ensuring more secure and efficient transaction processing.

What action is required?

Our records show that you use Flex API v1; Flex API v1 will reach end of life on July 1, 2025. You must upgrade to Flex API v2 on or before this date. Failure to do so will result in transaction failures.

Steps for migrating from Flex API v1 to v2 can be found in this Knowledgebase article:

https://support.visaacceptance.com/knowledgebase/Knowledgearticle/?code=KA-07698

If further clarification is required, you may also reach out to our Cybersource Customer Support team via your usual methods.

Thank You,

Cybersource Customer Support

Does any of this help to understand what the problem might be and does it shed any light on further things you might be able to look at to fix the situation please?

Do you want to be "looped in" with the email from ANZ Worldline, would that help?

I really don't know where else to turn to fix this so anything you can do to help would be greatly appreciated.

Thanks

Erin Skinner TOTAL EYECARE SUPPORT GROUP

Administration Manager



Total Eyecare Support Group

18 Magnet Court, Sandy Bay TAS 7005

P: 03 6231 5744 E: accounts@totaleyecare.com.au

Hi Erin,

Thanks for sharing the details. We’ve reviewed everything on our end and can confirm that it all matches. At this point, it would be best to reach out to Cybersource Support directly.
Here’s a draft email you can send:

Subject: 404 Error on /authentication-setups/ Endpoint – WooCommerce Integration
Hi Cybersource Support,
We are running a WooCommerce store and using the WooCommerce CyberSource plugin (v2.8.2).
  • Merchant ID: anztotalcon
  • Website: https://totalcontacts.com.au
  • Error Log:
    [2025-06-17T03:42:48] [ERROR] [ApiClient] : ApiException : [404] Error connecting to the API (https://api.cybersource.com/risk/v1/authentication-setups/)
Transient tokens are being generated successfully via /microform/v2/sessions , but the call to /risk/v1/authentication-setups/ consistently returns a 404 error.

Could you please advise what we might be missing? Is there a setting or service (such as Payer Authentication / 3D Secure) that needs to be enabled on our Cybersource account?
This integration has been working fine up until recently, so we’re wondering if something may have changed on the account configuration.

Hi Joel,

Yes, I went to Payment Configuration, Key Management, and then I went to Generate Key. But the details that generated are different to the API that shows when I go to Payer Authentication Configuration…

I'm really sorry but I'm trying to process wages this morning and am struggling with time to spend on this, especially as I really don't know how the IT side of this works…

This is probably a risk, but I have attached both of these informations for you, can you please enter what you need to into the site? I have given you the "screenshot" of the API information, and then in a separate file I have given you the key that was generated when I went to "Generate Key". It is the "Generate Key" information that I entered into the link you provided, but seemingly doesn't work..?! Should it be a combination of them both?

Last time we needed to update this I gave the information to Heath and he entered it in, so I'm not sure which of these details was used.

Please let me know how you go.

Thanks

Erin Skinner TOTAL EYECARE SUPPORT GROUP

Administration Manager



Total Eyecare Support Group

18 Magnet Court, Sandy Bay TAS 7005

P: 03 6231 5744 E: accounts@totaleyecare.com.au

I'm very concerned that this issue has been ongoing now since (most likely) Thursday afternoon and we still haven't got it resolved. Could you please attend to this now urgently for us?

Hi again Joel,

Hi Erin,

I hope you're doing well.

We’ve been looking into this, and if there’s been a recent change with ANZ, it’s quite possible that some updates are needed in your CyberSource dashboard. Do you have access to the CyberSource account to check this?
Once that’s confirmed, the new API credentials may also need to be updated on the website.

When you're ready, feel free to add the updated details here, or let us know if you'd prefer to send them another way.

Just a quick note — the CyberSource credit card payment option is currently disabled on the site to prevent any failed transactions.

Hi Erin,

We are looking into this, We have disabled the credit card for now to avoid any credit card transaction.
We will get back to you asap.

Dear WolfIQ,

Further to an email you will have received from our info@totalcontacts.com.au address this morning, please see my correspondence to Heath Maguire on Friday and this morning in regards to the same issue.

I haven't yet received a response from him but details in my email may assist if the problem we are experiencing relates to the upgrade I have mentioned.

Please let me know if I can provide any other details or there is anything we need to be doing at our end.


Thank you!

Hi Heath!


Happy Friday 13th! lol


I'm wondering if you or one of your colleagues would mind having a quick look at our Total Contacts website please?
We have had 2 customers report that their credit card payment has been unsuccessful this morning due to an "error", and I have confirmed through our Cybersource gateway that no credit card transactions at all have successfully gone through for todays date.


On the other hand, we have had both Paypay and Afterpay transactions go through ok this morning.


We are wondering if there is a problem with credit card payments but are not sure where to look to check this. Is this something you can look at for us please and then let me know if there is something more we need to be doing?


Thank you!
